summary: Recipe-sharing web app with Internet Identity accounts, public browsing, user-submitted recipes, plus a dedicated home page/feed, comments, likes, and recipe photo uploads.
architectural_notes: Authentication is based on Internet Identity (no traditional email/password accounts).
known_issues: Email login and email verification were requested but are currently not supported/available in this environment/account.

existing_features.title: Implement authentication using Internet Identity so users can sign in and sign out, and the UI reflects the current auth state (signed out vs signed in).
Create a public recipes experience where any visitor can browse a list of published recipes and open a recipe detail page that shows full recipe content.
Allow authenticated users to create and publish their own recipes via a 'New Recipe' form, and ensure that only the recipe owner can edit or delete their own recipes.
Create a coherent, distinct visual theme and apply it consistently across the site (typography, colors, spacing, and components) suitable for a food/recipe app; avoid a blue/purple primary palette.
Add generated static image assets to support the UI theme and render them from the frontend as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Add an authenticated “Monetize” page in the frontend where a signed-in user can manage their monetization settings: edit a list of support links (label + URL) and manage product listings (create/edit/delete; fields include title, description, price text, and external URL). Add navigation entry points so authenticated users can reach this page from the existing header UI.

Surface monetization information on public recipe viewing: on the recipe detail page, display the recipe author’s support links and product listings (if any), with each item linking out to its configured external URL. The display must be read-only for visitors and for non-owners.
Add a dedicated Home page that is the main landing page and provides access to a 'New recipes from other users' feed.

Implement backend support and frontend querying for a 'recent recipes' feed suitable for the Home page, ordered by creation time (newest first) and optionally filterable to exclude recipes authored by the caller when the caller is authenticated.
Add recipe comments: visitors can read comments on a recipe detail page, and authenticated users can add new comments.
Add recipe likes: visitors can see a recipe's like count, and authenticated users can like/unlike a recipe. Prevent multiple likes by the same user.

Allow authors to attach food photos to their own recipes during creation/editing, store the images on the canister with reasonable size/type limits, and display the photos on recipe detail and in recipe listings (thumbnail/preview).

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a food recipes website (browse/view recipes).
Allow users to share/publish their own recipes on the site.
Persist recipe data in the Motoko canister so that recipes remain available after page refresh and canister upgrades (using stable storage patterns).
Add a user account/profile page to store and display user information (e.g., display name, bio, avatar) alongside Internet Identity login.
Add monetization features to the recipe website (e.g., ads and/or paid content/products) so the owner can earn from the site.

Extend the backend data model and canister API to support per-user monetization information tied to Internet Identity, including: (1) user-managed external support links (e.g., “Buy me a coffee”, affiliate/store link) and (2) user-managed product listings (title, description, price text, and an external checkout URL). Ensure only the owning user (caller) can create/update/delete their own monetization data, and unauthenticated/public browsing can read monetization data needed for public display on recipe pages (by recipe owner principal).
Add a Home page that serves as the main landing experience for the recipe app.
Show a 'new recipes from other users' feed/listing (recently published recipes) accessible from the Home page.
Add comments on recipes (users can post comments; visitors can read them).
Add likes/favorites for recipes (users can like; show like count on recipes).
Allow users to add pictures of food to their own recipes (image upload/attach to recipe and display on recipe detail).

projectName: Food Recipes Website with Internet Identity Login and User-Submitted Recipe Sharing
